At the 2009 G-20 summit in Pittsburgh, Google chief executive Eric Schmidt suggested that multiplayer games could provide positive opportunities for improving business training and enhancing workplace collaboration. Speaking at a forum session, Eric Schmidt said: The game world is good training for a career in tech. It teaches players to build a network, to use interactive skills and thinking. Everything in the future online is going to look like a multiplayer game. If I were 15 years old, that's what I would be doing right now. Games appeal to people's natural competitive instinct, creating a sense of frustration and reward that increases engagement with the task at hand. spark for Detroit after a slow start, winning his first game since joining the Pistons, 100-92 over the Sacramento Kings on Tuesday night. "It was a huge lift off of me," Allen Iverson said. I knew it would happen. You think every game you go out and play it's going to happen. It feels good. I wanted to get the monkey off my back. I'm just excited that I got my first win and I can now try to get a lot more. Tayshaun Prince added 26 points and 11 rebounds for the Pistons, who had lost their first two games since acquiring Allen Iverson from Denver last week for All-Star point guard Chauncey Billups , key reserve Antonio McDyess and Cheikh Samb . California's state treasurer, Bill Lockyer , today denounced ongoing efforts to establish a new framework for states to restructure their debts, saying no state wanted or needed to declare bankruptcy. It's a cynical proposal, intended to incite a panic in response to a phony crisis, Mr. Bill Lockyer said in a conference call with journalists. "Killer bees, space aliens, and now it's the invasion of the bankrupt states." As reported, a number of members of Congress

Headteachers will be able to discipline pupils who misbehave on their way to and from school but rules forcing teachers to give parents 24 hours notice of a detention will be scrapped. Mr Michael Gove said: This Government backs teachers. All the evidence from those countries with great education systems tells us that nothing is more important than attracting great people into teaching and supporting them in the classroom. "Teachers will be free to impose the penalties they need to keep order and free from the red tape which swallows up teaching time, so they can get on with their first duty- raising standards. But the bill also includes an unexpected additional clause making university students pay higher rates of interest on tuition fee loans. The Government says this has to be included before the new university funding regime
